Mix 2 Marvel Superheros and try to make the best combination possible. Don't pick people like the Beyonder or Phoenix. If a hero was capable of destroying the universe already then they are deemed too powerful. So far the best ones my friends have made are:
 
 The Flash and Juggernaut- The Juggernaut cannot be stopped once he gains momentum and the Flash can gain momentum without moving.
 
 Superman and Magneto- Superman is pushing the too powerful line so try not to use him.
 
 Nightcrawler and Rogue- I made this one and the next one. I could teleport to you and then grab you and you would be helpless.
 
 Exodus and Destiny- I could know what you are about to do and stop you ahead of time.
 
 See what you can come up with and try and give a short explanation why.

Mix 2 Marvel Superheros...
 Superman and Magneto- Superman is pushing the too powerful line so try not to use him...

 Before anything else is said, isn't Superman DC comics?
 
 
 How about Mr. Fantastic and Batman. No need to use the tools in your bat belt to go up tall buildings when you can just stretch your anatomy to the top of the building. (By the way, Batman is also DC, does DC count or not?)

Yeah DC will count too. I always get mised up with which hero's are from where so I don't want to figure it out. Which reminds me, Mr. Fantastic and the Flash would be a wicked combo. Lightning fast punches from a football field away.emoticon_xgood

Hm
 
 I would like to combine Superman and Batman because if you combine Supermans strength and flying with Batmans intelligence, you have an unstoppable force. 
 
 But you said to try and not use Superman because he is already so powerful, despite his allergic reactions. 
 
 So what about Flash and Batman? Bats brains and skills with the high speed connection.
What about a northstar/ storm combo. A huricane at supersonic speed. that would be someting to see.

Well even though Batman was always one of the coolest, he never had any supernatural abilities (other than being a trained ninja of course). He was just a really rich guy who made really cool gadgets. Think of mixing him and Iron Man though. You'd have no powers at all, but a heck of a lot of money and equipment. And Northstar could move himself at supersonic speed, so creating a tornado wouldn't necessarily happen any faster if he were mixed.

How about Mr. Fantastic and Batman. No need to use the tools in your bat belt to go up tall buildings when you can just stretch your anatomy to the top of the building. (By the way, Batman is also DC, does DC count or not?)

 
Well even though Batman was always one of the coolest, he never had any supernatural abilities (other than being a trained ninja of course). He was just a really rich guy who made really cool gadgets.

 But Batman's gadgets are exactly what makes him so cool. They're part of why it is easy to relate to him. Because (outside of being fabulously wealthy) he's just a normal guy with no special powers. He just uses his intelligence to do what he needs to do.

[Batman] just uses his intelligence to do what he needs to do.

 It's him being rich that allows him to "get such wonderful toys" as Jack Nicholson said as the Joker.

It's him being rich that allows him to "get such wonderful toys" as Jack Nicholson said as the Joker.

 Of course. All I meant was, he's still able to take people down without superpowers.

Of course. All I meant was, he's still able to take people down without superpowers.

 I don't doubt that's what you meant. All I'm saying is that the fact that he's a rich business exec (of Wayne Enterprises) makes it less easy for someone to associate with him. The only reason he's able to take down the criminals is because he is rich. If he weren't rich, then all he could do is kick butt. (And when many of the villains have some kind of power of their own, super or superficial, he would need the stuff that he gets through the money he has to take them down.)

I don't doubt that's what you meant. All I'm saying is that the fact that he's a rich business exec (of Wayne Enterprises) makes it less easy for someone to associate with him. The only reason he's able to take down the criminals is because he is rich. If he weren't rich, then all he could do is kick butt. (And when many of the villains have some kind of power of their own, super or superficial, he would need the stuff that he gets through the money he has to take them down.)

 Rich or not, he's still more human than superheroes with powers.

Rich or not, he's still more human than superheroes with powers.

 Fair enough.
 
 Hey, while we're at it, why don't we combine BatMan with Super Man. With Super Man's strength and BatMan's skills and riches, he could easily take down Lex Luthor how it hurts...like business men.
I think wallninja's right. I think Superman's more than powerful enough as it is. Hence the name I suppose :)

I think wallninja's right. I think Superman's more than powerful enough as it is. Hence the name I suppose :)

 But why can't he really take down Lex Luther? There are at least 2 reasons. One, Superman can't kill. Well, he could kill but he refuses to (which is why he's a super hero and not a supervillion.) Also, Lex can buy his way out of jail. All corporate exects have that ability as though they own the police. If Super Man's strength were mixed with BatMan's riches, then Lex could be taken down because BatMan could afford to overrule Lex's paying to get out of jail.
Also, Super Man may have all those powers but that's only because of the yellow sun the fact that not too many people have green kryptonite.

emoticon_idea I've got a new idea. Mix the Hulk and the Thing! Then you'd have an unstoppable giant green brick! emoticon_xagree 
 
 Ok, so maybe it isn't a great idea. It would looke funny at least.
I want to mix the powers of Kitty (the girl who could go through walls in X-Men) with Spider-Man. Then the super hero could both climb up a wall or go through it.
Mix Kitty Pride and Nightcrawler and then you'd have a master escape artist.
Speaking of double posting, mix Multiple Man with Archangel and you could recreate the scene from the Wizard of Oz with one man.
